descriptions: The student does not follow the procedure at all or makes significant errors that invalidate the results.
The student attempts to follow the procedure but makes several critical errors that affect the outcome.
The student follows most of the procedure but misses some steps or makes minor errors.
The student follows the procedure with only one or two minor inaccuracies.
The student accurately follows the procedure with no errors, ensuring reliable results.
The student flawlessly follows the procedure, demonstrating precision and a clear understanding of each step and its impact on the outcome.
The student provides no analysis of the results or the analysis is completely unrelated to the text.
The student attempts to analyze the results but demonstrates a poor understanding of the text's explanations.
The student identifies some results and attempts to connect them to the text, but the analysis is superficial.
The student analyzes the results and makes a reasonable connection to the explanations in the text.
The student thoroughly analyzes the results, providing clear and accurate interpretations based on the text.
The student provides a nuanced and insightful analysis of the results, demonstrating a deep understanding of the text's explanations and their implications.
The student's report is disorganized and lacks clarity, making it difficult to understand the procedure or results.
The student's report is somewhat organized but lacks clarity in several areas, hindering understanding.
The student's report is generally organized and clear, but there are some areas where improvement is needed.
The student's report is well-organized and clear, effectively communicating the procedure and results.
The student's report is exceptionally clear and well-organized, presenting the procedure and results in a logical and easy-to-follow manner.
The student's report is a model of clarity and organization, demonstrating exceptional communication skills and a deep understanding of the material.
